forumNotes.author: mateuszek
forumNotes.content:
So it is: KINGSTON Data Traveler 2.0 2GB with chip SKYMEDI SK6281. Download this: [http://flashboot.ru/...s-file-139.html](http://flashboot.ru/Files-file-139.html "External link")(I am not sure but probably this tool works only on XP)

create one LUN (fixed disk) and one CDROM drive, as cdrom image use for example vistape, have on it plop, grub files and some other files for testing. On this fixed lun install grub4dos or fbinst. Most computer in my work boot it - most boot USB-CDROM (vistape) and this fixed disk lun is visible in grub. It is bootable even by AWARD 2008, 2009 without problems. Oldest computer i had - Award bios 2002 boot it too but not as cdrom so it is not load vistape image but it boot this fixed lun drive so i can have vistape on this fixed lun or better livexp for that old hardware and run it. Unfortunately plop does not allow to boot such cdrom from his cdrom. He says : no cd in drive, so plop can not see usb-cdrom. But this is most compatible pendrive ever - if wont boot usb-cdrom he will boot usb-hdd. So it is better than LEXAR so far, all 25 computers from year 2002 - 2010 in my work - booted fine. If i find not bootable - i will try to find this thread and write it here. So kingston has better compatible chip than sandisk cruzer titanium - when doing the same, exactly thing (cdrom and disk with gonzor customizer) - bios hangs and need to force reset. Kingston works , sandisk - does not.
